results.name: default/mysql-6b6dcbfb8d-25xmc
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-7cc545c8bc-jrgxh
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql-service

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-6b6dcbfb8d-25xmc], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is missing ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod mysql-6b6dcbfb8d-25xmc`. 3. Resolve any issues (e.g., image pull errors, crash loops). 4. Ensure readiness probes are correctly configured.

results.name: default/wordpress-service

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-7cc545c8bc-jrgxh], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is missing ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-7cc545c8bc-jrgxh`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues or errors.
4. Fix any configuration or resource issues.
5. Restart the pod if needed.
